Class Skeletonize3D_

java.lang.Object
  Skeletonize3D_
All Implemented Interfaces:
ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
public class Skeletonize3D_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

Main class. This class is a plugin for the ImageJ interface for 2D and 3D thinning (skeletonization) of binary images (2D/3D).

This work is an implementation by Ignacio Arganda-Carreras of the 3D thinning algorithm from Lee et al.

Version:
1.0 11/19/2008
Author:
Ignacio Arganda-Carreras
See Also:

Lee, Kashyap and Chu (1994) Building skeleton models via 3-D medial surface/axis thinning algorithms. Computer Vision, Graphics, and Image Processing, 56(6):462â€“478 doi:10.1006/cgip.1994.1042.

Based on the ITK version from Hanno Homann http://hdl.handle.net/1926/1292

Skeletonize3D homepage

                               int z)
Get neighborhood of a pixel in a 3D image (0 border conditions)

Parameters:
image - 3D image (ImageStack)
x - x- coordinate
y - y- coordinate
z - z- coordinate (in image stacks the indexes start at 1)
Returns:
corresponding 27-pixels neighborhood (0 if out of image)

isEulerInvariant

boolean isEulerInvariant(byte[] neighbors,
                         int[] LUT)
Check if a point is Euler invariant

Parameters:
neighbors - neighbor pixels of the point
LUT - Euler LUT
Returns:
true or false if the point is Euler invariant or not

isSimplePoint

private boolean isSimplePoint(byte[] neighbors)
Check if current point is a Simple Point. This method is named 'N(v)_labeling' in [Lee94]. Outputs the number of connected objects in a neighborhood of a point after this point would have been removed.

Parameters:
neighbors - neighbor pixels of the point
Returns:
true or false if the point is simple or not

octreeLabeling

private void octreeLabeling(int octant,
                            int label,
                            int[] cube)
This is a recursive method that calculates the number of connected components in the 3D neighborhood after the center pixel would have been removed.

Parameters:
octant -
label -
cube -
